27 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
28 // A helper class for tracing function calls while debugging.
29 // This is exported in the DLL in order to let the testing framework
30 // use it.
31 struct PL_DLL_API plTracer
32 {
33 private:
34  std::string str_;
35  static unsigned int count;
36 
37 public:
38  static void message( std::string const & msg );
39 
40  static unsigned int depth() { return count; }
41 
42  plTracer( const plTracer& other );
43  plTracer& operator=( const plTracer& other );
44  plTracer( std::string const & str );
45  ~plTracer();
46 };
47 
48 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
53 
55 #define PL_MSG(x) \
56  do { \
57  std::ostringstream msg; \
58  msg << "(DD) " << __FILE__ << ":" << ((int) __LINE__) \
59  << " " << __FUNCTION__ << " " << x << "\n"; \
60  std::cerr << msg.str(); /* std::cerr.flush(); */ \
61  } while (0)
62 
66 #define PL_TRACE(a) \
67  std::ostringstream pl_trace_msg__; \
68  pl_trace_msg__ << "(DD) " << __FUNCTION__ << ": " << a; \
69  plTracer tracer(pl_trace_msg__.str())
70 
73 #define PL_TRACE_MSG(a) \
74  do { std::ostringstream pl_trace_msg__; \
75  pl_trace_msg__ << "(DD) " << __FUNCTION__ << ": " << a; \
76  plTracer::message(pl_trace_msg__.str()); } while (0)
77 
82 #define PL_TRACE_MSG_FUN(f) \
83  do { std::ostringstream pl_trace_msg__; \
84  pl_trace_msg__ << "(DD) " << __FUNCTION__ << ": "; \
85  f(pl_trace_msg__); \
86  pl_trace_msg__ << std::endl; \
87  plTracer::message(pl_trace_msg__.str()); } while (0)
88 
89 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
96 
97 #if defined(DEBUG) && defined(PL_ENABLE_DEBUG_TRACE)
98 # define PL_DEBUG_TRACE(msg) PL_TRACE(msg)
99 # define PL_DEBUG_TRACE_MSG(msg) PL_TRACE_MSG(msg)
100 #else
101 # define PL_DEBUG_TRACE(msg) /* nothing */
102 # define PL_DEBUG_TRACE_MSG(msg) /* nothing */
103 #endif
104 
105 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
106 // Use the C++ RTTI to extract the class-name.
107 template< typename T >
108 std::string pl_rt_type( const T& o )
109 {
110 #ifdef __GNUC__
111  const std::type_info & ti = typeid(o);
112  int status;
113  char* realname = abi::__cxa_demangle( ti.name(), 0, 0, &status );
114  std::string result = realname;
115  free(realname);
116  return result;
117 #else
118  return "(non-printable type)";
119 #endif
120 }
121 
122 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
123 // Use the C++ RTTI to extract the class-name, and print the object.
124 template< typename T >
125 std::ostream& pl_print_object_info( std::ostream& out, const T* o )
126 {
127  out << "Object at " << std::hex << o << std::dec << " is a "
128  << pl_rt_type(*o) << ": " << *o << std::endl;
129  return out;
130 }
